derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: pseudo-Spanish alteration of the obsolete noun desperate. Both desperate and desperado originally denoted a person in despair or in a desperate situation, hence someone made reckless by despair

entry.def: A desperado is someone who does illegal, violent things without worrying about the danger.

means.word_mean: 1. a bold outlaw (especially on the American frontier)

auth_sentence.content: The two-gun desperado was one of the most dangerous criminals ever encountered in the history of New York.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不顾一切的,铤而走险的;绝望的,危急的
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉+sper希望+ate……的→去掉希望的
pro很多+sper希望+ous……的→希望很多→兴旺的
a不+sper希望+ity表名词→不给人希望→粗鲁,暴力

stems_affixes.value_cn: 暴徒,[尤指早期美国西部的]亡命之徒
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉,无+sper希望+ado人→无希望之人
desperate[adj.不顾一切的,铤而走险的;绝望的,危急的]+ion表名词→n.铤而走险,拼命

stems_affixes.value_cn: 成功,兴隆,昌盛,使成功,使昌隆,繁荣
stems_affixes.word_buile: pro很多+sper希望→很多的希望→繁荣
